total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the pattern in the input grids of the examples. The pattern seems to be that the grid is mirrored vertically, with the top half being the original and the bottom half being the mirror image.
Q2: Identify the elements that are being mirrored in the input grid. In the examples, these are the rows with non-zero elements.
Q3: Determine the position of these elements in the input grid.
Q4: Mirror these elements to the corresponding positions in the bottom half of the grid.
Q5: Ensure that the mirrored elements maintain their original arrangement in the mirrored half.
Q6: Apply this pattern to the input grid of the quiz to generate the output grid.
Q1: Identify the pattern in the input grids of the examples. The pattern seems to be that the first row of numbers is mirrored at the bottom of the grid.

Q2: Identify the pattern in the output grids of the examples. The pattern seems to be that the first row of numbers is mirrored at the bottom of the grid, and the numbers in the middle of the grid are also mirrored at the bottom.
Q3: Identify the transformation from the input grid to the output grid. The transformation seems to be that the numbers in the middle of the grid are mirrored at the bottom.
Q4: Apply the transformation identified in Q3 to the input grid of the quiz.
